title: AI will create more jobs, but only in companies with these 3 factors: Meta CMO Alex Schultz explains the growth equation for future
description: Metas Chief Marketing Officer Alex Schultz says the impact of AI on jobs hinges on three factors: efficiency gains that cut roles, creation of entirely new work, and affordability of previously cost-prohibitive projects. Speaking on The A16z Podcast (as reported by Business Insider), Schultz noted AI could both shrink and expand workforces, depending on how these forces interact. He added that the arrival of artificial general intelligence could redefine the balance altogether.
content:

title: Why 3D AI Studio Is Becoming Essential for Architecture and Interior Design Firms
description: The architecture and interior design industries are at a pivotal moment. Once reliant on hand-drawn sketches, foam models, and static renderings, firms are now being pushed by clients and market forces to adopt more dynamic visualization tools. At the forefront of this shift is artificial intelligence paired with three-dimensional rendering. One platform leading this transformation […]

title: AI-Fixated Traders Pile Into Teradyne, Other Obscure Chip Stocks
description: Chip stocks have become a favorite way to bet on artificial intelligence. But after big runups in companies like Broadcom Inc., investors are turning to an often overlooked group — suppliers of the gear used to make semiconductors.

title: AI is transforming how software engineers do their jobs. Just don’t call it ‘vibe-coding’
description: By MATT O’BRIEN One of the hottest markets in the artificial intelligence industry is selling chatbots that write computer code. Some call it “vibe-coding” because it encourages an AI coding assistant to do the grunt work as human software developers work through big ideas. Others dislike that term. But there’s no question that these tools […]

title: The Dual Reality: Booming U.S. Economy vs. Stagnant Job Growth
description: In 2025, the U.S. economy is growing at nearly 4% with minimal job creation, possibly due to artificial intelligence. The Federal Reserve is easing policies amidst weak labor markets. Capex is rising while payrolls stall, creating a complex economic landscape that investors and economists are trying to decipher.
content: As 2025 approaches its close, the U.S. economy presents a conundrum: a robust GDP growth rate nearing 4%, contrasted starkly by stagnant job creation. This puzzling scenario may find its roots in the advent of artificial intelligence and other techno... [680 chars]

description: UNESCO wants to influence the “development of artificial intelligence" in Africa with a legion of trained civil servants and legal personnel.

title: Top A.I. Researchers Leave OpenAI, Google and Meta for New Start-Up
description: Founded by a co-creator of ChatGPT, Periodic Labs aims to build artificial intelligence that can accelerate discoveries in physics, chemistry and other fields.
content:

title: Donald Trump H-1B visa curbs push US firms to consider shifting more work to India
description: Trends such as growing adoption of artificial intelligence and increasing curbs on visas are pushing U.S. firms to redraw labour strategies, with GCCs in India emerging as resilient hubs blending global skills with strong domestic leadership
content: Donald Trump's H-1B visa crackdown, opens new tab will hasten U.S. firms' shift of critical work to India, turbocharging the growth of global capability centres (GCCs) that handle operations from finance to research and development, economists and in... [4175 chars]

title: Here's How Much ChatGPT-Maker OpenAI Made In First Half Of 2025
description: Artificial Intelligence giant and maker of ChatGPT, OpenAI, generated around $4.3 billion in revenue during the first half of 2025, The Information reported citing financial disclosures to shareholders. Still yet to be listed on the Nasdaq, OpenAI burned as much as $2.5 billion in artificial intelligence research and development. During the first half of 2025, the company burned $6.7 billion in research and development.
content:
